duck: Proportional (fair division) means that each of n players thinks that they received 1/n of the cake.
Body proportions, in art, are the study of relation of human body parts to each other and the whole
A proportional control system is a type of linear feedback control system
The ratio of one quantity to another, especially the ratio of a part compared to a whole. In a mathematical context, a proportion is the statement of equality between two ratios.
proportionality definition: corresponding in size, degree, or intensity.
Proportionality (mathematics), the relationship of two variables whose ratio is constant

Proportionality (law), A legal principle under municipal law in which the punishment of a certain crime should be in proportion to the severity of the crime itself, and under international law an important consideration when assessing the military necessity of an attack on a military objective
Proportionality (political maxim), A maxim which states that any layer of government should not take any action that exceeds that which is necessary to achieve the objective of government
Proportion (architecture) describes the relationships between elements of a design

POWER inquiry calls for radical power shift in British democracy

Iraqis vote in massive numbers
NZ opposition leader admits to fundamentalist contacts
IBM releases freeware for visualizing document histories
New Zealand general election: National, Labour TV debate
Voting chaos in Germany expected
US Supreme Court overturns death penalty for child rape
Former Japanese prime minister Hashimoto indicated his retirement
Polls Closed in The New Zealand 2005 General Election
2006 New Zealand Maori Electoral Option
Ontario may adopt new voting system
Mitt Romney wins 2012 Nevada caucuses
Pollution in Arctic carried by seabirds

wiki.text:
'Proportionality' may refer to:

*Proportionality (mathematics), the relationship of two variables whose ratio is
constant *Proportionality (law), A legal principle under municipal law in which
the punishment of a certain crime should be in proportion to the severity of the
crime itself, and under international law an important consideration when
assessing the military necessity of an attack on a military objective
*Proportionality (political maxim), A maxim which states that any layer of
government should not take any action that exceeds that which is necessary to
achieve the objective of government


'Proportion' redirects here. Proportion may refer to: *The ratio of one quantity
to another, especially the ratio of a part compared to a whole. In a
mathematical context, a proportion is the statement of equality between two
ratios. *Proportion (architecture) describes the relationships between elements
of a design *Body proportions, in art, are the study of relation of human body
parts to each other and the whole *Proportions, or geometric aspect ratio

'Proportional' redirects here. Proportional may refer to: *Proportional (fair
division) means that each of <math>n</math> players thinks that they received
<math>1/n</math> of the cake. *A proportional control system is a type of linear
feedback control system *Proportional representation in electoral systems
*Proportional fonts
